title: Grazia magazine typeface
content:
Does anyone know the typeface used for Grazia the fashion magazines main identity?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021221329im_/http:/typophile.com/files/11111_4156.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021221329im_/http:/typophile.com/files/site_logo_5155.gif)

cheers people
author: adamtovey

comments.content:
Which typeface?  
I think the logo is not a typeface, but a custom-drawn lettering.

"Victoria [...]" is set in Mendoza:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-mendoza-roman/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021221329/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-mendoza-roman/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-mendoza-roman/")

"Rise [...]" is set in some quirky revival of Garamond.

-- [omine.net](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021221329/http:/www.omine.net/)

FYI - type identification requests are best posted in the [Type ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021221329/http:/www.typophile.com/forum/29) section of the site. You will get many more eyes on it and most likely a faster response.
